snippet: The gunman raged against the “filthy ways of the west” and spoke of “Islamic state vengeance,” a United States senator revealed.
abstract: Investigators say Orlando nightclub shooter Omar Mateen used several Facebook accounts to conduct searches on law enforcement agencies and terrorism and to write posts declaring allegiance to Islamic State; Mateen reportedly even searched online for references to massacre while he was busy carrying out worse mass shooting in American history.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER, FRANCES ROBLES and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA
byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Jensen Beach, Richard Pérez-Peña from New York, and Frances Robles from Orlando. Eric Lichtblau and Mark Mazzetti contributed reporting from Washington, Brent McDonald from Orlando, and Kitty Bennett from New York.

lead_paragraph: The gunman raged against the “filthy ways of the west” and spoke of “Islamic state vengeance,” a United States senator revealed.

headline.main: Omar Mateen Posted to Facebook Amid Orlando Attack, Lawmaker Says
headline.print_headline: Gunman in Orlando Posted to Facebook During Nightclub Attack, Lawmaker Says

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
